page.title: 16Boughton Village
page.content:
{ Boughton,}like its neighbour Ollerton, has developed in two main stages. The{old village}dates back to at least the 16th. century, and the {newer houses}have been built mainly since 1960 to house employees of the N.C.B.
Boughton village is a neat traditional English village complete with Church (St. Matthews,built in 1868),Village Hall, Green,Manor House (now used as a{convent_St.Joseph's) and three public houses.
The rest of Boughton consists of newer houses built in three estates and mostly owned by Newark District Council. There is also a considerable amount of{farmland,}mainly used for winter cereal crops.
